intro: Calandrinia sanfurgoi, commonly known as the desert candy flower, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvidae family and is characterized by its small, showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has a compact growth habit with fleshy, succulent leaves that help it retain water in dry environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Calandrinia sanfurgoi is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low precipitation.
